## ğŸ“¦ Installation

```bash
pip install rplcopilot
```

(Optional, for global access:)

```bash
chmod +x rpl.py
ln -s $(pwd)/rpl.py /usr/local/bin/rpl
```

## ğŸ§ª Commands

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl init <project>`

Create a new project in the current directory.

```bash
rpl init quantum --description "Quantum film experiments"
```

## ğŸ“ Project Structure

```
your-lab-project/
â””â”€â”€ .rpl/
    â”œâ”€â”€ config.json               # Global pointer to current project
    â””â”€â”€ projects/
        â””â”€â”€ <project-name>/
            â”œâ”€â”€ metadata.json     # File info + summaries
            â”œâ”€â”€ logs/             # Individual experiment logs
            â”œâ”€â”€ uploads/          # Uploaded raw files
            â””â”€â”€ faiss_index/      # Vector store
```

---


### ğŸ”¹ `rpl log`

Log an experiment with rich metadata.
Flags:

--title â€“ Title of the experiment (required)

--notes â€“ Full notes or description

--tags â€“ Comma-separated tags or keywords


```bash
rpl log --title "Day 1" --notes "Tested sapphire substrate." --tags "GHz,permittivity"
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl upload <file_or_folder>`

Upload and embed documents. Handles PDFs, scanned files, papers.

```bash
rpl upload notes.pdf
rpl upload ./papers/
```

Includes:
- Chunking + embeddings (FAISS)
- Semantic enrichment (summary, keywords, type detection)

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl query "<question>"`

Ask natural language questions against indexed documents.

```bash
rpl query "What trends were found using sapphire substrates?"
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl hybrid "<question>"`

Run hybrid search (BM25 + vector similarity) for improved retrieval.

```bash
rpl hybrid "Show experiments on dielectric response at 10 GHz"
```

Optional export:

```bash
rpl hybrid "sapphire films" --export json
rpl hybrid "quantum well" --export bib
rpl hybrid "mid-IR optics" --export tex
```
âš–ï¸ Combines symbolic + vector retrieval. Great for exact terms and fuzzy matches.



---
### ğŸ”¹ `rpl digest `

Generate a digest-style summary of uploaded files.
Includes:

ğŸ“„ File name

ğŸ§  Summary (LLM-generated)

ğŸ·ï¸ Keywords

```bash
rpl digest --format md
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl trace "<concept>" `

Trace a concept or keyword across all indexed files.
Flags:

--k â€“ Number of top documents (default: 10)

--format â€“ Export format: md, json, or bib

```bash
rpl trace "sapphire substrate" --format md

```
ğŸ” Outputs all occurrences with context, source, and exportable summary.



---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl ls`

List all available `.rpl` projects found in subdirectories.

```bash
rpl ls
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl switch <project>`

Switch the active project context.

```bash
rpl switch metasurfaces
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl current`

Display the current project in context.

```bash
rpl current
```

---

### ğŸ”¹ `rpl push`

Prepares syncing payloads for a remote API.
Reports:

ğŸ“ Files to sync

ğŸ“š Metadata size

ğŸ§  Embeddings (optional)

```bash
rpl push
```

- **`.tex`** â€” ready-to-include experiment snippets for LaTeX
